title: Kärnten Golf Open
text:
The Kärnten Golf Open was a <a href="golf">golf</a> tournament on the <a href="Challenge%20Tour">Challenge Tour</a>, played in <a href="Austria">Austria</a>. It was held for the first time in 2009. It was contested over the <a href="Pete%20Dye">Pete Dye</a> designed <a href="golf%20course">course</a> at the <a href="Golf%20Club%20Klagenfurt-Seltenheim">Golf Club Klagenfurt-Seltenheim</a> in <a href="Klagenfurt">Klagenfurt</a> from 2009 to 2012. In 2013 it moved to <a href="Jacques%20Lemans%20Golf%20Club">Jacques Lemans Golf Club</a> in <a href="Sankt%20Georgen%20am%20L%C3%A4ngsee">Sankt Georgen am Längsee</a>. In 2014 it moved to the <a href="Golfclub%20Schloss%20Finkenstein">Golfclub Schloss Finkenstein</a> in <a href="G%C3%B6dersdorf">Gödersdorf</a>.
The tournament was presented by <a href="European%20Tour">European Tour</a> player, and Austria's top ranked <a href="professional%20golfer">professional golfer</a> at the time, <a href="Markus%20Brier">Markus Brier</a>, who also played in the inaugural event to promote golf in the country and his charitable foundation.
